data.title: Westfield Washington School District
data.meta_description: All Aboard Program - Westfield Washington School District
data.text:
Registered families can download the new EZ ChildTrack Parent Portal app! This is a secured app and requires you to first have a child enrolled in a program before you are able to use the app.

Click the EZ ChildTrack link to the left to go to our Parent Portal website, then scroll down to the bottom of the Login page to press your app store button. After the app has downloaded, and you have opened it, there is no longer any need to scan a QR Code. Just return to our Parent Portal website and press the app store button a second time. Done! Again, in order to use the app, you must first have a child enrolled in a program.

Important Dates for 2024-25 TOTS and All Aboard

January 4, 2024 -- Open house at 5:30 and 6:00 PM to tour a few classrooms and common areas

January 8-February 5, 2024 -- 2024-25 TOTS and All Aboard open enrollment (all returning and new families must submit enrollment)

February 16, 2024 -- Parents notified of 2024-25 TOTS and All Aboard enrollment status

August 1, 2024 -- Meet the Teacher Night at the Early Learning Center from 5:30 to 7:00 pm

August 5, 2024 -- First day for the 2024-25 TOTS and All Aboard programs

Posted at the top of this web page is the recorded virtual parent information meeting for 2024-25 TOTS and All Aboard programs. The virtual meeting includes details about the programs, instructions to submit enrollment and the placement process.

2024-25 TOTS and All Aboard Materials

Below are the links to download information and pricing for the 2024-25 program.

2024-25_TOTS_and_All_Aboard_Calendar

2024-25_TOTS_& All_Aboard_Fees

What does each plan include for 2024-25_TOTS_and_All_Aboard

You must complete the steps listed below by February 5, 2024 to submit your child's 2024-25 TOTS enrollment for consideration.

Submit online enrollment between January 8, 2024 starting 6:00 AM through February 5, 2024 ending 11:59 PM. Click here to download the EZ ChildTrack Online Enrollment instructions

Click 2024-25 All Aboard Child Information and Enrollment Application to download, print and complete.

The following must be received by February 5, 2024 by 4:00 PM to the address listed below:

A $175 registration check made payable to Westfield Washington Schools

A copy of your child's birth certificate

Proof of residency by submitting a copy of a utility bill, purchase agreement, or rental agreement

Virginia F Wood Early Learning Center

19500 Tomlinson Road, Suite A

Westfield, IN 46074

Attn Donna Benedict

All Aboard Pre-K Program

The Virginia F Wood Early Learning Center located at 19500 Tomlinson Road, Suite A, Westfield opened in August of 2022. Our beautiful facility provides childcare and learning experiences for children between the ages of 12 weeks old through 4 years old. The building is also the location for Westfield Washington Schools Developmental Preschool Program.

2024-25 Virginia F Wood Early Learning Center Open House and Virtual Parent Meeting

Please plan to attend the 2024-25 open house on Thursday, January 4, 2024. Please choose to attend either the 5:30 PM or 6:00 PM tour of a few classrooms and common areas at Virginia F Wood Early Learning Center.

The Virginia F. Wood Early Learning Center will have a virtual parent meeting link posted here soon to provide information about the 2024-25 TOTS and All Aboard program including instructions to submit enrollment and the placement process. Please check back here soon for this link.

Westfield Washington Schools 2024-2025 All Aboard Pre-k Program is designed for children who will be 4 years old by August 1, 2024 and will be entering kindergarten the 2025-2026 school year. The All Aboard curricular-based classrooms emphasize an enriched kindergarten readiness curriculum. The program offers two levels of service to meet family child care needs and a desire to assure full readiness as the child enters Indiana's full day kindergarten classrooms the following school year.

The program is located at the Virginia F Wood Early Learning Center and has limited enrollment (filled by lottery selection, if necessary). This program is available to families who live in the Westfield Washington School district boundaries and children of Westfield Washington School employees. Placement is solely the decision of the Director of Student Support Programs.

School Cancellations and Delays

Click here to download the procedures TOTS and All Aboard will follow regarding school delays and/or cancellations.

The TOTS Pre-School and All Aboard Pre-K programs are eligible to enroll in break care plans. Break care will be at the Virginia F. Wood Early Learning Center. Both the All Aboard and Preschool age have the option to enrollment in any of the breaks and can select specific days to attend. Enrollment is limited and has additional fees.

Families have the option of choosing only the days needed during breaks.

Remember enrollment and/or changes must be completed no later than 2 weeks prior to the start of a break.

Because of staffing and state licensing requirements, we cannot accept unregistered drop-ins.

Enrollment is Limited

Break Care billing is a separate cost.

Fall Break October 21-25, 2024 (enroll / withdraw by 10-7-24)

Winter Break December 23, December 26-31, and January 2-3 (closed 12-24, 12-25, and 1-1) (enroll / withdraw by 12-9-24)

Spring Break April 4-11, 2025 (enroll / withdraw by 3-21-25)

Non-School Days for Teacher Planning and Parent Conferences

TOTS & All Aboard are open as usual on teacher planning/parent conference days.

Dates Closed

TOTS and All Aboard will be closed on the following days:

September 2, 2024

November 27-29, 2024

December 24-25, December 31 closing at 3:00 PM, and January 1, 2025

January 20, 2025

February 17, 2025

May 26, 2025

Important Program Information

State guidelines for care will be followed and ratios will be honored

Program design will combine pre-k activities with a “home like” atmosphere

Staffed by Westfield Washington Schools employees with Early Childhood training or experience

Members of the NAEYC (National Association for the Eduction of Young Children)

School cafeteria lunch may be purchased or a lunch from home may be packed

Enrollment is limited

Contact Information

Direct all inquiries to our Student Support Programs Enrollment Office at (317) 896-4803 or (317) 896-4808 or mychild@wws.k12.in.us.
